titleStmt.title: Gospel-conversation: wherein is shewed, I. How the conversation of believers must be above what could be by the light of nature. II. Beyond those that lived under the law. III. And suitable to what truths the Gospel holds forth. By Jeremiah Burroughs, preacher of the Gospel to Stepney and Criplegate, London. Being the third book published by Thomas Goodwyn, William Greenhil, Sydrach Simpson, Philip Nye, William Bridge, John Yates, William Adderly.
titleStmt.author: Burroughs, Jeremiah, 1599-1646.
Goodwin, Thomas, 1600-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Peter Cole, at the sign of the Printing-Press in Cornhil, near the Royal Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The words "Thomas Goodwyn, .. Philip Nye," and "William Bridge, .. William Adderly." are bracketed together on title page.
"To the reader" signed: Thomas Goodwyn [and 6 others].
Includes "The misery of those men that have their portion in this life" (caption title).
